snippet: The end of the early Obama administration’s stimulus program brought years of shrinking spending by governments, which is just now beginning to grow again, slowly.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes that preliminary figures on size of United States economy indicate that in first three quarters of 2014 government grew at annual rate of 1.8 percent, after adjusting for inflation; contends that government's growth is milestone, and if it does not shrink significantly in current quarter it will be first year since 2009 that real government gross domestic product has risen at all.
lead_paragraph: The end of the early Obama administration’s stimulus program brought years of shrinking spending by governments, which is just now beginning to grow again, slowly.

headline.print_headline: Government Shows Growth, After Years of Shrinking
headline.main: Government Shows Growth, After Years of Shrinking
